There exist constants $r,$ $s,$ and $t$ so that
\[p(n) = rp(n - 1) + sp(n - 2) + tp(n - 3)\]for any quadratic polynomial $p(x),$ and any integer $n.$  Enter the ordered triple $(r,s,t).$

Let $p(x) = ax^2 + bx + c$. Then $p(n) = an^2 + bn + c$.
$p(n-1) = a(n-1)^2 + b(n-1) + c = a(n^2 - 2n + 1) + bn - b + c = an^2 + (-2a + b)n + (a - b + c)$.
$p(n-2) = a(n-2)^2 + b(n-2) + c = a(n^2 - 4n + 4) + bn - 2b + c = an^2 + (-4a + b)n + (4a - 2b + c)$.
$p(n-3) = a(n-3)^2 + b(n-3) + c = a(n^2 - 6n + 9) + bn - 3b + c = an^2 + (-6a + b)n + (9a - 3b + c)$.
Then
\begin{align*} rp(n-1) + sp(n-2) + tp(n-3) &= r(an^2 + (-2a + b)n + (a - b + c)) \\ &\quad + s(an^2 + (-4a + b)n + (4a - 2b + c)) \\ &\quad + t(an^2 + (-6a + b)n + (9a - 3b + c)) \\ &= (ra + sa + ta)n^2 + (r(-2a + b) + s(-4a + b) + t(-6a + b))n \\ &\quad + r(a - b + c) + s(4a - 2b + c) + t(9a - 3b + c) \\ &= an^2 + bn + c \end{align*}
Comparing the coefficients of $n^2$, $n$, and the constant terms, we have the following system of equations:
\begin{align*} ra + sa + ta &= a \\ r(-2a + b) + s(-4a + b) + t(-6a + b) &= b \\ r(a - b + c) + s(4a - 2b + c) + t(9a - 3b + c) &= c \end{align*}
From the first equation, $r + s + t = 1$.
From the second equation, $-2r - 4s - 6t = 1$, so $2r + 4s + 6t = -1$.
From the third equation, $r + 4s + 9t = 1$.
\begin{align*} r+s+t &= 1 \\ 2r + 4s + 6t &= -1 \\ r + 4s + 9t &= 1 \end{align*}
From the first equation, $r + s = 1 - t$.
From the second equation, $2(1 - s - t) + 4s + 6t = -1$, $2 - 2s - 2t + 4s + 6t = -1$, $2s + 4t = -3$, $s + 2t = -3/2$.
From the third equation, $1 - t + 3t = 1$, $1 + 2t = 1$, $2t = 0$, $t = 0$.
If $t = 0$, $r + s = 1$ and $s = -3/2$, so $r = 5/2$.
$(r, s, t) = (5/2, -3/2, 0)$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\left( \frac{5}{2}, -\frac{3}{2}, 0 \right)}$
